Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Decision Support Interventions for Older Women with Breast Cancer

Trial_Design.evidence: Units were randomised 1:1 to either DESIs or usual care

Participants.evidence: recruiting women aged 70 years or above with operable breast cancer. Units were randomised 1:1 to either DESIs or usual care, stratified by primary endocrine therapy and chemotherapy rates.

Intervention.evidence: The DESIs included an online tool, booklet, and decision aid.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was quality of life (QoL) at 6 months, assessed using the EORTC QLQ-C30.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was by block, and allocation was concealed.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 1339 women were randomised (670 intervention, 669 usual care) between December 2015 and June 2018.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Intention-to-treat analysis showed no significant difference in global QoL at 6 months

Result_Outcome.evidence: Intention-to-treat analysis showed no significant difference in global QoL at 6 months (difference -0.20, 95% CI -2.69 to 2.29; P = 0.900).

Harms.evidence: No significant adverse events were reported.

Funding.evidence: Funded by the National Institute for Health Research (NIHR).
